name: Michael's Inn By The Falls

reviews.text: Very nice place to explore Niagara Falls both on Canada and US sides. Located within walking distance from town centre and Rainbow bridge. Good sized rooms with kinda classic furniture. The only negative point - it was quite cold in the room, so had to keep the heating on all the time while in room.
reviews.title: Nice and inexpensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the Michael's Inn. The price was fantastic, the staff was incredible, the room was larger than average. The only issue we had was the smell of smoke in our room, other than that it was great.
reviews.title: Hurry up and go before the prices go up! Best kept secret in Niagara!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a lovely 5 minute walk to the falls / main attractions, and the nicest service we have experienced in NF.
reviews.title: The staff at Michaels Inn goes the extra mile

reviews.text: Would go back in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: overall good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Michaels Inn has never let us down in all the years we have been going there. The staff is friendly and will help you in any way they can. Anytime we are in Niagra we never hesitate to stay at Michaels Inn. It is close to everything and lacks nothing. I would tell anyone going to Niagra to check out Michaels Inn. Ask for Carl at the front desk, he will meet all your needs....
reviews.title: Great service and price, fantastic view!

reviews.text: in a town where you cant find any place to stay for under $25O, this is a good deal, no fancy rooms, no luxurys, but good location, free parking, clean place. the room felt a little damp, but after leaving the air on for the whole day, at night it was more pleasant.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Michael's Inn in mid-July for our first trip to Niagara Falls. We stayed in a balcony room overlooking the river and, if you stood on the left side of the balcony, you could see the American Falls off to the right. We were disappointed that we couldn't enjoy the scenery when we sat down because there was a long horizontal plastic part of the railing that blocked our view. Also, there were lights on the balconies that attracted bugs at night, making it hard to enjoy the balcony during the evening. The room decor was dated and the bathroom fixtures were old and worn. We found all the above to be minor inconveniences because this Inn did have a LOT of good features! The rooms were very clean and housekeeping always offered assistance if we ever needed anything. The room temperature was comfortable and the beds were EXTREMELY comfortable! The parking was free and quite ample with two lots available, one within the Inn and one lot behind the Inn. We had the breakfast buffet once and, although pricey, we found an excellent variety of delicious food. The location of the Inn was away from the very busy tourist area, yet, we felt safe walking around this quiet area at night. The tourist attractions are all within walking distance of the Inn, but we found the distance to the Horseshoe Falls to be quite a hike. However, if you go up about two blocks from the main road by the falls, you could find parking lots with cheap rates (about five dollars a day). Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Michael's Inn, and would stay here again if we ever return to Niagara Falls.
reviews.title: Overall, A Decent Place for the Price

reviews.text: I stayed three days in July. As I had read in other reviews, the hotel needs some updating. I stayed in a cityview room and looked at the parking lot. I was there more for relaxation than going all the time or a view.
reviews.title: Close to the the falls but restful

reviews.text: The upside for me is that it was close to the falls without being in the hubbub of the tourist area. The room was clean and I did not hear others around me or on the streets. Although the person at the desk said there was no wireless in the room, I found access that was satisfactory. That may not have been the case for all, since I saw people on their computers in the lobby. It was very easy to get to from the Rainbow bridge, and the free parking was a plus. I did not eat at the restaurant.
reviews.title: Not really a view

reviews.text: The pool was small but acceptable, as was the spa. The room was fine for one or two but would have been tight with more people.
reviews.title: Best Value in Niagra Falls !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK...here we go..
reviews.title: Why did I book this disaster :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always wanted to stay here because of the good reviews I have read. So I thought a long deserved getaway with my husband would be great at Michael's Inn....boy was I wrong. I am just glad my kids didn't have to suffer with us. If you read any of my other reviews, you will see I am not hard to please, and by no means fancy....read on you'll see...
reviews.title: don't stay in this dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In- Quick, uneventful, pleasant. The 2 keys she gave me were HUGE for the door. HUGE...I should have ran then...no swipey cards...humungous keys.
reviews.title: Great location and well worth it!

reviews.text: Room: Mismatched furnishings, stripes, flowers, different flowers...scary! The wall paper was peeling off the walls. Ok, older hotel, possible until we realized how damp and icky the room felt. Well, we rushed out quickly t meet friends and decided to deal with it later. When we got back, the room was smelly, musty, humid, gross. The bathroom, tiny..tiny...tiny...Itsty bitsty bathtub that was old and gross. It was gross, and I am not exaggerating. We used tissue to flush and open water taps and sit on the toilet.
reviews.title: Great location for the right price, but heartshaped red plastic spa?

reviews.text: The beds..oh my...the sheets were damp. DAMP! They bed didn't look made under the comforter so now here are me and my hubby thinking the sheets are dirty from the last guests. The air conditioner was as loud as a freight train. Seriously, I am not lying. I did not sleep all night long. Finally at 6:30 am I got up to take a shower...still grossed out..I just wanted to get the heck out of there. (By the way, no fan in the bathroom so the moisture will stay in this room)
reviews.title: Fourth of July stay -- Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for just a space to lay your head, this is your hotel, the amenities were sparse, the rooms old and outdated, but in a pinch on a serious budget, you can't get much cheaper. It reminded me of the run down hotels by the sea in England.
reviews.title: When you pay cheap, you get cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good proximity to "old casino".
reviews.title: Average hotel with reasonable rates and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some rooms had noisy air conditioning.
reviews.title: Book on line not from door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some rooms need to be re-done..look tired.
reviews.title: Clean & well kept, but other guests were a problem
BAD MANAGEMENT
reviews.text: Nice swimming pool and hot tub.

aka: Michael`s Inn By The Falls Hotel Niagara Falls
description: This hotel is just a 10-minute walk from the Canadian Horseshoe Falls and Casino Niagara. An indoor pool, hot tub, and sauna are available. All rooms have free Wi-Fi and a cable TV is provided.Michael's Inn Fallsview offers a fitness centre for guests' convenience with a 24-hour reception desk.The entertainment area of Clifton Hill is within a 10-minute walk of the hotel.
